cyclone.name: OPHELIA
cyclone.category: Tropical Storm (not yet on SSHS scale)
cyclone.current_location: about 345 mi SE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest, forecast to turn north and make landfall along the central-northern North Carolina coast then track inland across the Mid-Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central North Carolina coast (near Cape Lookout–Cape Fear area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm Surge Watch from Surf City NC to Duck NC, Chesapeake Bay north of Windmill Point to Smith Point, Tidal Potomac south of Colonial Beach, remainder of Albemarle and Pamlico Sounds
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Cape Fear NC to Fenwick Island DE, Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds, Chesapeake Bay south of North Beach, Tidal Potomac south of Cobb Island; Storm Surge Warning Duck NC to Chincoteague VA including lower Chesapeake Bay, Neuse & Pamlico Rivers, portions of Albemarle & Pamlico Sounds
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeast U.S. coast from South Carolina northward through North Carolina and into the Mid-Atlantic states
weather_observation.wind: Low chance (≤6%) of sustained tropical-storm-force winds; occasional gusts 30–35 mph possible Friday as the system passes well offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected along the Georgia coast; forecast surge zone begins north of South Santee River, SC.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands may bring 1–2 inches of rain Friday into early Saturday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along Georgia beaches.
